The provided code has a logical error in that it uses `i` instead of `j` when setting `id_value`. Assuming the intention was to set `id_value` to the index `j` where `arr[j] == target`, the loop invariant can be stated as follows:

id_value = fun(arr[0]->arr[j-1])

However, given the logical error, a corrected version of the loop invariant, considering the intended functionality, would be:

id_value = fun(arr[0]->arr[j-1]) if target not found else j

But sticking strictly to the requested format and assuming the intention was to use `j` correctly within the loop:

id_value = fun(arr[0]->arr[j-1])
